intro: Dorstenia tubicina var. opifera, commonly known as the velvetleaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. The species is also valued for its edible tubers, which are used in traditional cuisines.
